criteria: Distinguishing Between Communicable and Non-Communicable Diseases
descriptions: Shows no understanding of communicable diseases.
Struggles to define communicable diseases and provides inaccurate examples.
Can define communicable diseases with limited accuracy but struggles to provide relevant examples.
Accurately defines communicable diseases and provides basic examples.
Clearly defines communicable diseases and provides relevant and varied examples.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of communicable diseases, provides insightful examples, and explains the mechanisms of transmission.
Shows no understanding of non-communicable diseases.
Struggles to define non-communicable diseases and provides inaccurate examples.
Can define non-communicable diseases with limited accuracy but struggles to provide relevant examples.
Accurately defines non-communicable diseases and provides basic examples.
Clearly defines non-communicable diseases and provides relevant and varied examples.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of non-communicable diseases, provides insightful examples, and explains the risk factors associated with them.
Cannot differentiate between communicable and non-communicable diseases.
Struggles to identify the key differences between the two types of diseases.
Identifies some differences between the two but lacks clarity and accuracy.
Clearly distinguishes between communicable and non-communicable diseases based on transmission.
Clearly distinguishes between communicable and non-communicable diseases, providing examples of each and explaining the mechanisms of transmission and risk factors.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of the differences between communicable and non-communicable diseases, including transmission, risk factors, prevention strategies, and societal impact.
